html: Jehovah appears with these warlike terrors because He is coming for a great judgment. “For in the midst of fire Jehovah holds judgment, and in the midst of His sword with all flesh; and great will be the multitude of those pierced through by Jehovah.” The fire, which is here introduced as the medium of judgment, points to destructive occurrences of nature, and the sword to destructive occurrences of history. At the same time all the emphasis is laid here, as in Isaiah 34:5-6 (cf., Isaiah 27:1), upon the direct action of Jehovah Himself. The parallelism in is progressive. Nishpat 'ēth , “to go into judgment with a person,” as in Ezekiel 38:22 (cf., עם in Isaiah 3:14, Joel 3:2; 2 Chronicles 22:8; μ ετά , Luke 11:31-32).
